entries.meaning: A person or thing that disguises.
examples: A voice disguiser alters a person’s voice to protect their anonymity.
Incense can be used as an odour disguiser.

entries.meaning: (archaic, historical) A person who wears a disguise; an actor in a masque or masquerade; a masker.
examples: […]  out of a caue in the said Rock came .x. knightes, armed at all poyntes, & faughte together a fayre tournay. And when they were seuered & departed the disguysers dissended from the rock & daunced a great space: & sodeynly the rocke moued & receaued the disguysers, & ymediatly closed agayn.
